intro: Sympagis monadelpha, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshade plants. The plant produces small, round, yellow-orange fruits that are encased in a rough, spiny husk. These fruits are edible when ripe and have a tangy, sweet flavor. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its culinary uses.
